quotes: 'Roger Federer is the greatest tennis player of all time.' - John McEnroe
'I've always believed that if you put in the work, the results will come.' - Serena Williams
'If you don't practice, you don't deserve to win.' - Andre Agassi
'Tennis is 90% mental. Of course, you have to physically have a certain level, but it’s about your head, too.' - Stan Wawrinka
'One important key to success is self-confidence. An important key to self-confidence is preparation.' - Arthur Ashe
'I fear no one, but respect everyone.' - Roger Federer
'I hate to lose more than I love to win.' - Jimmy Connors
'You have to believe in the long-term plan you have, but you need the short-term goals to motivate and inspire you.' - Roger Federer
'If you can keep playing tennis when somebody is shooting a gun down the street, that’s concentration.' - Serena Williams
'I like putting money back into the community. The reason I do it is because I believe in it.' - Venus Williams
'My motto is: I’m alive, so that means I can do anything.' - Venus Williams
'I never look back, I look forward.' - Steffi Graf
'Everything is possible as long as you put your mind to it.' - Martina Hingis
'What makes something special is not just what you have to gain, but what you feel there is to lose.' - Andre Agassi
'When you do something best in life, you don’t really want to give that up— and for me, it’s tennis.' - Roger Federer
'I've always had the will to win. I felt it baking cookies. They had to be the best cookies anyone baked.' - Billie Jean King
'Champions keep playing until they get it right.' - Billie Jean King
'Tennis has given me soul.' - Martina Navratilova
'The mark of great sportsmen is not how good they are at their best, but how good they are at their worst.' - Martina Navratilova
'I think self-awareness is probably the most important thing toward being a champion.' - Billie Jean King
'In tennis, you strike a ball just after the rebound for the maximum speed, but that’s not possible if you aren’t prepared.' - Boris Becker
'If you’re a champion, you have to have it in your heart.' - Chris Evert
'I was always in the tennis business from the moment I was 15 years old.' - Gabriela Sabatini
'When you lose a couple of times, it makes you realize how difficult it is to win.' - Steffi Graf
'It’s been very beautiful. I’ve had a chance to think about it and look back at all the things I’ve done in my career so far.' - Roger Federer
'Everybody always talks about the pressure of playing at Wimbledon, how tough it is. But the people watching make it so much easier to play.' - Serena Williams
'You live with the highs and lows of tennis, but you still have to be calm in the moment.' - Kei Nishikori
'I love tennis! I love the challenge. I love to put on a show for the crowd.' - Nick Kyrgios
'When I was a child, I was a dreamer. I read comic books and imagined me a superhero. I’m still doing that now, sometimes.' - Novak Djokovic
'I love the winning, I can take the losing, but most of all I love to play.' - Boris Becker
'Stay strong, be brave, love hard and true, and you will have nothing to lose.' - Maria Sharapova
'Being number one is very special, but tennis is a conversation between you and your racket, with an opponent across the net.' - Rafael Nadal
'It’s very important not to think about losing.' - Venus Williams
'A champion is afraid of losing. Everyone else is afraid of winning.' - Billie Jean King
'Regardless of how you feel inside, always try to look like a winner.' - Arthur Ashe
'Tennis has given me so much, and it’s all thanks to the fans who've been supporting me since day one.' - Rafael Nadal
'I’ll let the racket do the talking.' - John McEnroe
'I don’t play in any tournament to come second best.' - Andy Murray
'I love the winning, but you can’t win every time. You have to accept mistakes and keep going.' - Novak Djokovic
'The serve is the key to modern tennis; everything flows from that first shot.' - Pete Sampras
